title: Consumers say their environmental concerns are increasing due to extreme weather; study shows they're willing to ... - PR Newswire
summary: Research from Bain & Company indicates that over 60% of businesses are not meeting their sustainability goals despite increasing environmental concerns among consumers and employees. The study highlights that a significant portion of consumers is willing to pay more for sustainable products, but faces barriers due to high pricing and a disconnect between consumer expectations and company offerings. It emphasizes the need for companies to address sustainability authentically and effectively by understanding consumer behavior and adapting to regulations. The firm underscores the importance of upskilling employees to improve sustainability practices within organizations.

title: Crocs is taking its used shoes back in 10 states. Here's why - GreenBiz
summary: Crocs launched a shoe take-back program in 10 U.S. states to reduce waste and explore material reuse, addressing the environmental impact of footwear production. The company aims to incorporate circular economy principles into its design and production processes while committing to source 50% of its material from bio-based options by 2030. However, it has faced scrutiny due to a delay in reaching its net-zero emissions goal and a low percentage of sustainable materials currently used. Industry experts view Crocs' circular strategy as still developing, highlighting the challenges in scaling take-back programs in footwear.
green_innovation: TRUE, because Crocs' take-back program and commitment to circular design principles aim to minimize waste and promote sustainability in the footwear industry.
business_innovation: TRUE, because Crocs is introducing an improved business process through its shoe take-back program, which differs significantly from its previous operations.
green_product: TRUE, because Crocs' products are designed to be more sustainable by using materials and processes intended to reduce environmental impacts.
green_process: TRUE, because the take-back program and focus on recycling and renewable materials demonstrate a method that minimizes environmental impacts.
